name: gusplease
text: The Whole Sick crew, partying in the bathroom.

name: saint
text: Ray booked the Tenmen for the 200 Flushes party? That's pretty impressive.

name: vymora
text: I think it's less that Ray booked them then that they were simply in the tub.

name: luckypyjamas
text: maybe he won them in a contest?

name: farqussus
text: The Tenmen just know where to be.

name: evilbobikus
text: It's the same as with the GOF.  When an event becomes epic enough, the Tenmen appear, ready to celebrate the happening with their music.

name: ketelcat
text: Two thousand flushes, dude. Also, how did Click Robot unbury himself?

name: fineoakstructure
text: That was Philippe's imagination; Click Robot was in the corner the whole time.

name: vweep
text:
Not a mere two hundred, my friend.
Two [IMGS OFF]

name: vweep
text: NOOOOOOO!

name: gunsofray
text: chubbied for Epic Failure Of Some Proportion.

name: peterselj
text: By their nature, epic failures are of epic proportions.

name: greyfield
text: Thomas Pynchon references = a thousand blessings upon your land, good sir. I cannot chubby you enough.

name: history
text: Hold on...is that the same painting on the wall that will show up on Ray's Magical Mexican Sarape/sheep years later?

name: geysershitdick
text: A comment left by geysershitdick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mattfish, J-Man, aperson)

name: scorpio_nadir
text: This is a perfect strip. Click-Robot doing the click-boogaloo to the tubbed TenMen...Any strip where Onstadt is wondering wtf in his own alt-text....

name: robo-key
text: A comment left by robo-key was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, divot, tttt, tttt2, equinn2006, milkpants, Boxus, Doc_Rostov, yingkaixing, Mastronaut)

name: dirtyantaeus
text: I feel bad for Philippe every other strip he's in. :(

name: arelladawn
text: Yeah it's just too sad.  But at least he bounces back.  I still haven't figured out exactly why he's living with these characters.

name: norsef
text: Every strip that ends with Phillipe in tears or screaming has been given a 5 by me. I'm kind of ashamed at what that says about me.

name: factorial
text: "'Screw you, man.' Why, I never." Imagining Cornelius saying this makes me laugh.

name: wonelove
text: you mean, just the " screw you, man " part?

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Click bot's dance is pure, unadulterated joy.

name: blueloggy
text: Poor Philippe! I love him.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Emeril just makes me smile every time I see him. I wish I knew somebody who talked the way he does.

name: riazm
text: You must become the change you wish to see in the world centipede_damascus. You know what you must do.

name: morypcaina
text: Become the ruling body.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ... dude!

name: tripperday
text:
I know what you mean. I know a decent Ray/R.B. combo, but I've never met an Emeril.

One day I'll move to New York or LA and meet someone like Emeril working in a record store, then he'll get annoying about halfway through our first trashspotting excursion.

name: catachresis
text: Todd all passed out in his own vom

name: nigelchaos
text: Good eye.

name: dangelder
text: it

name: petitegitan
text: This strip would get a 5, but I just can't stand to see Philippe that sad.

name: direhaggis
text: The 7th panel is a masterpiece among the archive. I desire cats in black suits to play music in my bathtub.

name: fosters
text: Sure it SOUNDS neat, but trust me, the execution is a logistical nightmare.

name: direhaggis
text: Your having attempted to put cats in black suits with musical instruments inside bathtubs having gone awry? That sucks.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: I always thought they were just black cats with white faces and sunglasses who made ridiculously awesome music

name: st-elmos_fire
text: mind you just should not be in that there comment

text: What's the picture on the wall in panel 7?

text: It looks kinda like Ralph Macchio.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Go read the alt text to this and feel really good...go on, go!

name: cdtm
text: Phillip should feed the click robot again.  Five times in a row.  He's too nice for it, unfortunately. :(

name: mcwee
text: I love that Ray has a Nagel (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Nagel) in his bathroom.  It's like crapping in a Korean nail salon!

name: tellumo
text: Evidently Ray did not get rid of those Nagels.

name: unsentletter
text: Wasn't that particular framed picture used on the wall of the game Glider for the Mac?

name: captainpeepers

name: deusoma
text: I just love that the Tenmen showed up to Ray's impromptu toilet party

name: choosebro
text: Beef is off rescuing Molly.

name: connellingus
text: This kind of makes me want to get a "SCREW YOU, MAN" tattoo.

name: clever-nickname
text: I am going to learn Emeril's dance.

name: muffinzz
text: That is an old school "Twist" that he's rocking.

name: johnmatrix
text: Philipe looks like he's wearing mascara.

name: ibetso
text: Lyle's face in panel 7 is great... I've been that kind of drunk where you have to close one eye and squint with the other in an attempt to see straight.

name: atmus
text: Don't worry little Phillipe, being in trouble is a fake idea.

name: glopdemon
text: But this is DEEP trouble

name: sp1derbaby
text: But unfortunately pianos are not.

name: cailetshadow
text:
I love:

That this bathroom is a perfect expression of Ray. Gigantic, yet all of the appliances came straight out of the bargain bin at Home Depot.

That Cornelius has no problem with Philippe being at a bathroom pot party until he accidentally gets a tattoo.

That there are Tenmen in the bathtub because no other comic artist would ever have done that.

Basically everything about Achewood.

name: apples
text: i love that click robot would intentionally reverse the writing he displays so that it would be burnt the right way on philippe, making him look the baddie. nasty genius

name: spinynorman
text: Goddamn sausagefest all up in Ray's place, but who gives a shit, have you seen his crapper? Fuggin thing's like a ceramic shrine...

name: stuart
text: Achewood is a sausagefest I don't know if you've noticed

name: spinynorman
text:
Yeah. It's sort of weird that way, isn't it? A bunch of late twenties, early thirties guys who still believe they're adolescents.

Or at least that's my interpretation.

You'd think if they were adolescents they'd get some goddamn poontang to toss around, though.

name: pogo
text: " A bunch of late twenties, early thirties guys who still believe they're adolescents."  Are you talking about Assetbar?

name: mr_lostman28
text:
Why whatever do you mean? *looks around*

... oh god. This is a sausagefest!!

name: mr_lostman28
text: Fun fact: I attended an all guys private high school. Before our first football game we would always have a big tailgate party. It eventually became sponsored by Kielbasa... and was subsequently named "The Annual Sausagefest"

name: pogo
text: And your oppponents probably called it a Weenie Roast.

name: mindbnder
text: This is not unlike every party I have attended.

name: epicurus
text: This is actually a rite of passage for young men in China.

name: slalvation
text: Toilet parties?

name: epicurus
text: Getting branded by Click Robot, but yours works too.

name: eatmorekix
text: oh my god i never noticed the alt-text before. 5/5.

name: rowboat
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: cpnglxynchos
text: wha'??

name: rowboat
text: cpnglxynchos, if your "wha'??" was directed at me, this picture is the one in Ray's bathroom. It is by a sort of bad artist.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
yes, i realize that's what it is. :) *not trying to sound like a cock to a stranger*

i guess i was more surprised to see, *psag*, something not formed by the O hanging about, though that happens in strips before and after. now, about your avatar. what in the dogg is that biz all about?

name: rowboat
text:
I think it pretty well speaks for itself.

[IMGS OFF]

name: achilleselbow
text: Did you pick that because it looks like Philippe? I've never actually heard that album, but Sons of Society is one of my favorites.

name: rowboat
text:
Naw, any resemblance to Lil' P is purely coincidental. I just have an undying love of this album and especially it's art.

By the way, Achilleselbow, you really need to hear some of the old stuff. Without Guy Speranza, they are a shadow of their former selves.

It's funny how many people thought it was an owl. I know it's real small and everything, but I can't believe no one assumed that it was a murderous, purple humanoid with the head of a seal. I mean, c'mon!

And just so you know what m'man's capable of:
[IMGS OFF]

name: alzuna
text: So it's not an owl?...My mind has been shaken.

name: tekende
text: Didn't Nagel do some album covers for Duran Duran?

name: rowboat
text: Indeed. Well, at least Rio.

name: tekende
text: Yeah, that's what I thought. Thanks.

name: morypcaina
text: Is the alt-text a (The) Fall reference, or do "L.A." and this strip refer to the same, other thing?

name: eatmorekix
text: they both refer to Beyond the Valley of the Dolls, one of my favorite movies O.A.T.

name: bob_lamonta
text:
you will drink the black sperm of my vengeance

and also:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZlZUOOnJ5hU

name: eatmorekix
text: how dare you refuse my alabaster charm?

name: dusty
text: around 1989 my aunt who was about 19 at the time lived with us for a while, she had several posters in her room just like the one in panel 7. I was a little kid at the time, but i remember the first time i had a reason to go in her room, After a few seconds of blank starring my response was exactly like cpnglxynchos' "wha'?"

name: drskradley
text: But... who is he in trouble with ? Who's his guardian? I believe it's Teodor, but I don't think this has been properly established.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Pat: SCREW heartburn!
Onstad: Tonight a woman showed me a video.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Who lamed the Blog Girl??

Whoever you are, I will take you the fuck down.

name: doc_rostov
text:
This is the lady you are looking for.

For future reference, to find out who lamed who, you can set your lame limit to one and look at the comment. It reveals the offenders. But I digress. I don't understand how the hell someone could lame such an exemplary wonder of the human race. Assetbar is a cruel mistress. ):

name: heccibiggs
text: Yeah, I know that technique - Rowboat taught it to me. But I don't like to use it too much; I fear its power .

name: spinynorman
text:
Most lames seem to come from people who have under fifty comments, I find.

Naturally, this comment will be lamed to oblivion. But I guess I'm willing enough to take the hit.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I've noticed that self-prediction of multiple lames often leads to few or none. That seems to be the case here so far.

But, back to the original question of "who lamed the Blog Girl?": this lame I'm more willing to rack this up to a possible mistake...? The lamer in question doesn't appear to be a troll of any kind, has posted over 200 comments and has way more chubbies than lames (98/4 ratio as of this posting).

Still, she didn't apologize, and that is bad form .

name: atticusonline
text:
7 Months later...

No Lames...

rowboat teaches us all
